isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - ASSEMBLE - INPUT SHAFT, BEARING CAGE, OIL PUMP AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

svcproc.title: INPUT SHAFT, BEARING CAGE, OIL PUMP AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

figure.caption: Figure 100. Input Shaft, Bearing Cage, Oil Pump and Inter-Axle Differential

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. OIL BAFFLE - UNITS WITHOUT OIL PUMP
12. OIL PUMP - UNITS WITH OIL PUMP

step1.para: Apply axle lubricant to the parts as they are being assembled. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

If removed, install the bearing cup in the input bearing cage. The cup is correctly installed when the bottom of the cup is fully seated in the cage bore. If the cup is being replaced, both the cup and cone must be replaced as a matched set.
Install a new oil seal in the input bearing cage ( Figure 101).

caution.para: Hold the seal only on the outer diameter. Do not touch the lips in the inner diameter of the seal. If you touch the lips on the inner diameter of the seal, you will contaminate the lips and could cause a leak between the shaft and the seal.
Do not apply pressure after the seal flange touches the top of the cage, or you will damage the cage.

step1.para: After the seal is installed, a gap of 0.015 to 0.030 inch (0.38 to 0.76 mm) can exist between the flange and the cage. The gap is a normal condition because of the flexible coating on the flange of the seal. Use a feeler gauge to measure the gap between the complete flange-to-cage area. If the gap varies more than 0.010 inch (0.254 mm) between the highest and lowest measurement, remove and reseat the seal ( Figure 102).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Gap of 0.015 to 0.030 Inch Can Exist

para.title: Carrier Assemblies without an Oil Pump

step1.para: Use a suitable sleeve to install the cone on the input shaft until it bottoms on the shoulder of the input shaft ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Install Cone on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the O-ring on the input bearing cage. Refer to Figure 100.
Install the input bearing cage so that the bearing cup and cone are engaged. Proceed to Step 14.

para.title: Carrier Assemblies with an Oil Pump

caution.para: Make sure the drive flats in the bore of the pump are aligned with the flats on the input shaft. If the flats are not aligned, the pump will be damaged.

step1.para: Put the input shaft so that the threads are toward you. If dowel pins are used, install the oil pump on the input shaft so that the dowel pin hole in the pump is toward the threads on the shaft. If a `drive flat' design pump is used, make sure that the drive flats in the bore of the pump are aligned with the flats on the input shaft. If a spline design pump is used, make sure the splines in the pump are aligned with the splines on the shaft ( Figure 104).

caution.para: When the bearing cone and the oil pumps are installed on the input shaft, put supports under the input shaft. Do not put supports under the oil pump. The oil pump will be damaged if pressure is applied to the body of the pump.

step1.para: Use a press and a sleeve to install the bearing cone on the input shaft. The cone is correctly installed when the bottom of the cone touches the shoulder on the shaft ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Install Bearing Cone on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the input bearing cage over the input shaft on the oil pump. If dowel pins are used, make sure that the dowel pins in the cage are aligned with the holes in the oil pump.
Install the bolts that fasten the oil pump to the input bearing cage. Tighten the bolts to 22 to 33 ft-lbs. (30 to 45 Nm).
Install the O-rings on the oil pump and the input bearing cage.

caution.para: Never use a hammer or a mallet to install the yoke or the flange.

step1.para: If removed, install the pressure relief valve assembly in the input bearing cage. Install the relief valve, the spring and the plug in the bore. Tighten the plug to 20 to 40 ft-lbs. (27 to 54 Nm) ( Figure 106).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Install Relief Valve, Spring, and Plug

step1.para: Inspect the yoke surface for scratches, corrosion or a wear track from the previous oil seal. Replace the yoke if any of these conditions exist.
Inspect the lead chamfer of the yoke for nicks and burrs which may damage the sealing lip during installation. Repair nicks and burrs with emery cloth where necessary.
Wipe the yoke sealing surface and face clean.

caution.para: Do not use a Speedi-Sleeve with Rockwell triple lip oil seals. The edge of the sleeve will catch and roll the center dust lip and result in early seal leakage.

step1.para: Install the yoke or the flange on the input shaft. Make sure that the input shaft is well supported ( Figure 107).

caution.para: Do not use the nut to draw the yoke onto the input shaft. Possible thread damage and probable incorrect yoke seating will result.

figure.caption: Figure 107. Install Yoke or Flange on Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the nut that fastens the yoke or the flange to the input shaft. Tighten the nut by hand. DO NOT TIGHTEN THE NUT TO THE SPECIFIED TORQUE VALUE UNTIL THE BEARING CAGE AND PUMP ASSEMBLY IS INSTALLED IN THE HOUSING.

Put the thrust washer in the pilot bore on the end of the helical drive gear. Install the helical drive gear and the thrust washer on the input shaft so that the thrust washer is toward the input bearing cage ( Figure 108).

figure.caption: Figure 108. Install Helical Drive Gear and Thrust Washer on Input Shaft

note.para: The inter-axle differential on 145 Series carriers is serviced as an assembly and cannot be disassembled.

step1.para: If disassembled, assemble the inter-axle differential on 160 Series carriers according to the following procedure.

step2.para: Apply the specified lubricant that is used in the axle housing to all of the parts of the inter-axle differential.
Install the pinion gears and the thrust washers on the spider.
Put the spider and pinion assembly in one of the case halves of the inter-axle differential.
Install the other case half over the case half and spider assembly. Make sure that the marks on each case half are aligned with each other.

Install four of the bolts that fasten the case halves together. Install the bolts so that the bolts are the same distance away from each other. Equally tighten the bolts to bring the case halves together.
Install the rest of the bolts. Tighten all of the bolts to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (60 to 75 Nm).

step1.para: Install the inter-axle differential to the input shaft so that the teeth in the differential case are away from the helical drive gear. Install the snap ring that fastens the case to the shaft ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Install Inter-Axle Differential and Snap Ring

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEADS OF BOLTS TOWARD HELICAL DRIVE GEAR (160 SERIES ONLY)

step1.para: Install the bearing cup for the rear side gear in the carrier housing. The cup is correctly installed when the bottom of the cup is seated against the bottom of the bore ( Figure 110).

note.para: If the bearing cone is replaced, the bearing cup must also be replaced. Replace the cup and the cone in a matched set from the same manufacturer.

step1.para: Install the bearing cone on the rear side gear. The cone is correctly installed when the bottom of the cone touches the shoulder on the side gear.
Install the oil screen and plug assembly into the suction line in front of carrier. Tighten the screen and plug assembly to 48 ft-lbs. minimum (65 Nm) ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Install Oil Screen and Plug Assembly
